item.title: Aylesbury
item.description: The Aylesbury Estate in Southwark contains 2,704 dwellings, spread over a number of different blocks and buildings, and was built between 1963 and 1977.

item.title: Blake Court
item.description: Summary Council housing in Brent, undergoing a proposed mixed tenure redevelopment regeneration. The estate has damp and mould problems in its properties.

item.title: Central Hill Estate
item.description: Summary Council housing in Lambeth, earmarked for demolition in regeneration plans; With 476 homes are earmarked for demolition, Central Hill is the largest of Lambethâ€™s five estates earmarked for demolition.

item.title: Eastfields, High Path, and Ravensbury
item.description: Summary Eastfields, High Path, and Ravensbury are three Clarion estates in Merton, all set to be redeveloped under the same plan.

item.title: Regina Road
item.description: Summary Regina Road is a Council housing estate in Croydon. It gained widespread notoriety for its poor conditions, particularly extreme dampness and mould, following an ITV News report highlighting the estate and subsequent spotlighted of it in their hour-long broadcast, *Surviving Squalor.
